Problem:
Consider a complex function \\( z(t) = x(t) + iy(t) \\), where \\( x(t) \\) and \\( y(t) \\) are governed by the differential equations \\( \\dot{x} = Ax \\) and \\( \\dot{y} = By \\), respectively, with A and B being constant matrices. We examine the effects of an integral transformation \\( f(z) = \\int_{0}^{t} e^{Ct}z dt \\), where C is another constant matrix.

After observing \\( z(T) \\) at time T, can we deduce the original function \\( z_0 \\) at t = 0 without knowing if the transformation \\( f(z) \\) was applied?
Explanation: Without knowledge of the application of the integral transformation \\( f(z) \\), it is not possible to trace back to \\( z_0 \\) unambiguously. The transformation \\( f(z) \\) involves an integration that might have significantly altered the trajectory from what would be expected under pure linear dynamics.
